channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Gunman shot own mother then a dad and daughter
item.description: Jake Davison murdered his mother Maxine before shooting and killing a father and daughter.

item.title: Police officer and child found dead in Kidderminster
item.description: The deaths in Kidderminster are being treated as unexplained, West Mercia Police says.

item.title: Banksy confirms East Anglian seaside artwork is genuine
item.description: The secretive artist claims responsibility for pieces along England's east coast.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Hiker's Pyrenees death an accident, police say
item.description: Sources say it is unclear what caused her to fall but her boots may have been unsuitable for ice.

item.title: Kadian Nelson: Man who raped girl on her way to school jailed
item.description: Kadian Nelson was chased away during the attack after a 10-year-old girl saw him snatch his victim.

item.title: Firefighters tackle huge blaze in North Tyneside
item.description: Witnesses report seeing smoke billowing across the River Tyne.

item.title: Care home deluged with cards for Jack Annall's 101st birthday
item.description: Jack Annall was sent the cards after being disappointed not to see his daughter on his birthday.

item.title: Who were the victims?
item.description: The gunman's mother, Maxine Davison, and three-year-old Sophie Martyn have been named among the dead.

item.title: A visual guide to what happened
item.description: A gunman shot and killed five people in Plymouth before turning the gun on himself. Here's what we know about how events unfolded.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: PM Boris Johnson - My thoughts are with the families
item.description: Boris Johnson also says it needs to be "properly investigated" how the gunman got a firearms licence.

item.title: Incels: A new terror threat to the UK?
item.description: Is the incel belief system followed by Jake Davison, the Plymouth gunman, a terror threat to the UK?

item.title: Plymouth Shootings: Home Secretary says many questions to be asked
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel says she'll be looking for answers about the shootings that left six dead.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Who can own a firearm or shotgun in the UK?
item.description: A shooting in Plymouth which left six people dead has put the focus on who can own a gun in the UK.

item.title: Shooting 'a truly shocking event' say police
item.description: Devon and Cornwall Police Chief Constable Shaun Sawyer explains how reports of the shootings came in.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Inside the dark world of 'incels'
item.description: Who are the angry young men who describe themselves as "involuntarily celibate"?

item.title: Plymouth MP: Community 'trying to make sense' of shooting
item.description: MP Luke Pollard says the community is pulling together in the face of the "deeply grim" news.

item.title: Covid-19: Bradford hairdresser found guilty of lockdown breaches
item.description: Sinead Quinn racked up £17,000 in fines after repeatedly breaking lockdown restrictions, court hears.

item.title: Bilsdale transmitter fire: TV and radio disruption could last up to 14 days
item.description: Mast operator Arqiva says work to put up temporary transmitters will take between seven and 14 days.

item.title: Shrewsbury police officer stalked ex out of 'twisted vengeance'
item.description: Stephen Green, 60, is given a six month sentence suspended for two years after admitting stalking.

item.title: Woman died on hold reporting boyfriend assault
item.description: Daniela Espirito Santo, from Grantham, was not failed by police, a watchdog says.

item.title: Covid vaccine fraudster who targeted 92-year-old woman jailed
item.description: David Chambers tricked his 92-year-old victim into paying £140 for a fake coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Car in near-miss with train on Cumbria level crossing
item.description: CCTV footage shows the car driving across the barrierless crossing in front of the Northern train.

item.title: Bolton woman inspired to create Muslim hiking group
item.description: Amira Patel says more women should be encouraged to become confident walking in the wild.

item.title: Bomb threat arrest at Northampton police station caught on film
item.description: A man is seen being tackled to the ground by officers after claiming he had a bomb in a bag.

item.title: Kane, Southgate and Sterling mural in Nuneaton nets £10,000
item.description: The three lions on the wall painting in Nuneaton helps to fund seven defibrillators.

item.title: Covid-19 testing 'mega lab' officially opens in Leamington Spa
item.description: The Leamington Spa facility has already processed about 300,000 coronavirus tests.

item.title: Murder-accused boy, 14, in court over stabbing
item.description: A 14-year-old boy appears in youth court charged with murdering James Markham.

item.title: Child killer allowed to appeal against sentence
item.description: Eltiona Skana, who killed Emily Jones in a park, is granted leave to appeal her life sentence.

item.title: Streatham attack: Sudesh Amman not treated for 80 minutes
item.description: Sudesh Amman was shot several times as he ran towards undercover officers while carrying a knife.

item.title: Buckland St Mary: Two die in light aircraft crash
item.description: A male and a female on board both died but formal identification has yet to take place.

item.title: Tribute to Manchester Arena bomb survivor found dead aged 20
item.description: Eve Aston is remembered as "very jolly, sassy, sociable" by her "proud" family.

item.title: Brentford 2-0 Arsenal: Bees earn fully deserved win over Gunners
item.description: Brentford mark their Premier League debut with a deserved win over Arsenal at a jubilant Brentford Community Stadium.

item.title: England v India: Rory Burns falls late to check hosts' fightback
item.description: England's spirited fightback in the second Test against India is dented by the loss of Rory Burns late on day two at Lord's.

item.title: The Hundred: Liam Livingstone hits 50 as Birmingham Phoenix beat Trent Rockets to go top of the table
item.description: Birmingham Phoenix move to the top of the men's Hundred table after a comfortable win over rivals Trent Rockets at Trent Bridge.

item.title: Jack Grealish: Aston Villa can be stronger following £100m sale of captain, says Dean Smith
item.description: Aston Villa can build a better team following the £100m sale of Jack Grealish, manager Dean Smith says.

item.title: The Hundred: Birmingham Phoenix beats Trent Rockets in must-win game in women's competition.
item.description: Birmingham Phoenix pull off a brilliant comeback victory over local rivals Trent Rockets at Trent Bridge to keep their hopes of making it out of the women's Hundred group stages alive.
